column4: I found drivers and am to like the last step of installing the thing
and i keep on getting this frustrating message
does anyone know what * No rule to make target `modules'. means?
yes I am trying to install drivers for a webcam
ok :)
I have a logitek web camera
and then I went here http://mxhaard.free.fr/download.html
to download the drivers for the camera
and I have been messing around with it for a couple of days
trying to get it installed
which model do you have?
have you installed kernel-headers?
try apt-get install linux-686
dpkg -l | grep linux-headers what shows?
I think you are right
that are strange versions
uname -a
try doing an sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
try sudo apt-get install linux-686 then, it will download a new kernel optimized for 686, then recheck for linux-headers package in sync with the new version
it cant find linux-686
how do I find what sources I am using outside of synaptic?
cat /etc/apt/sources.list | less
